intro: Riedelia ferruginea, commonly known as the rusty riedelia, is a member of the Acanthaceae family. It is a shrub-like plant native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from red to purple. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
